00053 /*****************************************************************************
00054 **
00055 **  VMEbus macros.

00058 /*
00059 **  VMEbus address modifiers
00060 */
00061 #define BT_AMOD_A32_SB      (0x0F)  /* A32 Extended Supervisory Block       */
00062 #define BT_AMOD_A32_SP      (0x0E)  /* A32 Extended Supervisory Program     */
00063 #define BT_AMOD_A32_SD      (0x0D)  /* A32 Extended Supervisory Data Access */
00064 #define BT_AMOD_A32_NB      (0x0B)  /* A32 Extended Non-Privileged Block    */
00065 #define BT_AMOD_A32_NP      (0x0A)  /* A32 Extended Non-Privileged Program  */
00066 #define BT_AMOD_A32_ND      (0x09)  /* A32 Extended Non-Privileged Data     */
00067 #define BT_AMOD_A32_SMBLT   (0x0C)  /* A32 Multiplexed Block Transfer (D64) */
00068 #define BT_AMOD_A32_NMBLT   (0x08)  /* A32 Multiplexed Block Transfer (D64) */
00069 
00070 #define BT_AMOD_A32     BT_AMOD_A32_SD
00071 #define BT_AMOD_A32_D64 BT_AMOD_A32_SMBLT
00072 
00073 #define BT_AMOD_A24_SB      (0x3F)  /* A24 Standard Supervisory Block       */
00074 #define BT_AMOD_A24_SP      (0x3E)  /* A24 Standard Supervisory Program     */
00075 #define BT_AMOD_A24_SD      (0x3D)  /* A24 Standard Supervisory Data Access */
00076 #define BT_AMOD_A24_NB      (0x3B)  /* A24 Standard Non-Privileged Block    */
00077 #define BT_AMOD_A24_NP      (0x3A)  /* A24 Standard Non-Privileged Program  */
00078 #define BT_AMOD_A24_ND      (0x39)  /* A24 Standard Non-Privileged Data     */
00079 #define BT_AMOD_A24_SMBLT   (0x3C)  /* A24 Multiplexed Block Transfer (D64) */
00080 #define BT_AMOD_A24_NMBLT   (0x38)  /* A24 Multiplexed Block Transfer (D64) */
00081 
00082 #define BT_AMOD_A24     BT_AMOD_A24_SD
00083 #define BT_AMOD_A24_D64 BT_AMOD_A24_SMBLT
00084 #define BT_AMOD_A24_MAX 0x1000000
00085 
00086 #define BT_AMOD_A16_SD      (0x2D)  /* A16 Short Supervisory Data Access    */
00087 #define BT_AMOD_A16_ND      (0x29)  /* A16 Short Non-Privileged Data Access */
00088 
00089 #define BT_AMOD_A16     BT_AMOD_A16_SD
00090 #define BT_AMOD_A16_MAX (0x10000)
00091 #define BT_AMOD_DP_MAX  (0x800000)

00165 /*****************************************************************************
00166 **
00167 **  PCI Configuration Register definitions
00168 **
00169 **  All PCI Device IDs registered to date are listed here.  Each device ID
00170 **  symbolic constant ends with the hardware model number.
00171 **
00172 *****************************************************************************/
00173 #define BT_PCI_VENDOR_BIT3      0x108a  /* PCI sig assigned Bit 3 Vendor Id */
00174 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_617       0x0001  /* NanoBus with DMA                 */
00175 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_614       0x0002  /* NanoBus without DMA              */
00176 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_616       0x0003  /* NanoBus low cost                 */
00177 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_RPQ890    0x0004  /* NanoBus SGI RPQ w/different swap */
00178 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_618       0x0010  /* NanoBus Fiber Interface          */
00179 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_619       0x0011  /* NanoBus Fiber Interface D64      */
00180 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_704       0x0040  /* NanoBus II Fiber Interface D64   */
00181 /* EAS A64 */           
00182 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_RPQ601332 0x0041  /* PCI A64 hardware */
00183 
00184 
00185 
00186 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_2500      0x0100  /* Broadcast Memory (PN 85601915)   */
00187 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_2510      0x0101  /* Broadcast Memory (PN 85601914)   */
00188 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_2500_1    0x0102  /* Broadcast Memory (PN 85601916)   */
00189 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_2510_1    0x0103  /* Broadcast Memory (PN 85601917)   */
00190 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_2590_1    0x0104  /* Shared Memory (PN 85601918)      */
00191 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_2591_1    0x0105  /* Shared Memory (PN 85601919)      */
00192 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_2506      0x0110  /* Broadcast Memory VME (PN 85631360*/
00193 #define BT_PCI_DEVICE_2516      0x0111  /* Broadcast Memory VME (PN 85631355*/
00194

00267 /*
00268 **  Types for forcing certain size storage
00269 */
00270 
00271 /* Assume there is a natural 64-bit type */
00272 
00273 #define BT_MAKE_DATA64(d64, hi, lo) ((d64)=((((bt_data64_t)(hi))<<32)|(lo)))
00274 #define BT_HI_DATA32(d64) ((bt_data32_t) ((d64) >> 32))
00275 #define BT_LO_DATA32(d64) ((bt_data32_t) ((d64) & 0xFFFFFFFFul))
00276 
00277 #if     defined(__sun)
00278 
00279 #if     !defined(bool_t)
00280 #define bool_t  int
00281 #endif  /* !defined(bool_t) */
00282 
00283 #if     defined(SUNOS5_5)
00284 #define uint8_t         unsigned char
00285 #define uint16_t        unsigned short
00286 #define uint32_t        unsigned long
00287 #define uint64_t        unsigned long long
00288 #define int8_t          char
00289 #define int16_t         short
00290 #define int32_t         long
00291 #define int64_t         longlong_t
00292 #define intptr_t        int
00293 #define timeout_id_t    int
00294 #endif  /* defined(SUNOS5_5) */
00295 
00296 #if     defined(SUNOS5_6)
00297 #define timeout_id_t    int
00298 #endif  /* defined(SUNOS5_6) */

00300 typedef uint8_t         bt_data8_t;
00301 typedef uint16_t        bt_data16_t;
00302 #define BT_FMT_D16      "%04hx"
00303 typedef uint32_t        bt_data32_t;
00304 #define BT_FMT_D32      "%08x"
00305 typedef uint64_t        bt_data64_t;
00306 
00307 #else   /* defined(__sun) */
00308 
00309 #if     !defined(bool_t)
00310 #define bool_t  int
00311 #endif  /* !defined(bool_t) */
00312 
00313 #if     !defined(CHAR_BIT) || !defined(UINT_MAX)
00314 #include <limits.h>
00315 #endif  /* !defined(CHAR_BIT) || !defined(UINT_MAX) */
00316 
00317 
00318 #if     CHAR_BIT != 8
00319 #error  This code assumes the character type is eight bits in size.
00320 #endif
00321 
00322 typedef unsigned char   bt_data8_t;
00323 typedef unsigned short  bt_data16_t;
00324 
00325 #define BT_FMT_D16      "%04hx"
00326 
00327 #if     UINT_MAX < 4294967295ul
00328 typedef unsigned long   bt_data32_t;
00329 #define BT_FMT_D32      "%08lx"
00330 #else   /* Can use unsigned int */
00331 typedef unsigned int    bt_data32_t;
00332 #define BT_FMT_D32      "%08x"
00333 #endif  /* UINT_MAX */
00334 
00335 #if     defined(__osf__)
00336 
00337 typedef unsigned long   bt_data64_t;
00338 
00339 #elif   defined(__sgi)
00340 
00341 typedef uint64_t bt_data64_t;
00342 
00343 #elif   defined(__GNUC__)
00344 
00345 typedef unsigned long long      bt_data64_t;
00346 
00347 #elif   defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1000)
00348 
00349 typedef unsigned __int64 bt_data64_t;
00350 
00351 #else   /* default- use a structure */
00352 
00353 #define BT_DATA64_T_IS_STRUCTURE (1)  /* Some optimizations are easier
00354                                          if we know this. */
00355 typedef struct {
00356     bt_data32_t hi;
00357     bt_data32_t lo;
00358 } bt_data64_t;
00359 
00360 /* Redefine the default macros for 64 bit data handling */
00361 #undef  BT_MAKE_DATA64
00362 #undef  BT_HI_DATA32
00363 #undef  BT_LO_DATA32
00364 
00365 #define BT_MAKE_DATA64(d64, up, low) (((d64).hi=(up),(d64).lo=(low),(d64)))
00366 #define BT_HI_DATA32(d64) ((d64).hi)
00367 #define BT_LO_DATA32(d64) ((d64).lo)
00368 
00369 #endif  /* defined(__osf__); defined(sgi); defined(__GNUC__);
00370            defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1000); default */
00371 
00372 #endif  /* defined(__sun) */
00373 
00374 /*
00375 **  Defines and types for specifing access widths
00376 */
00377 typedef size_t bt_width_t;
00378 
00379 #define BT_WIDTH_D8     sizeof(bt_data8_t)
00380 #define BT_WIDTH_D16    sizeof(bt_data16_t)
00381 #define BT_WIDTH_D32    sizeof(bt_data32_t)
00382 #define BT_WIDTH_D64    sizeof(bt_data64_t)
00383 #define BT_WIDTH_ANY    0
00384 
00385 /*
00386 **  Masks and shift values
00387 */
00388 #define BT_D4_MASK      0xf
00389 #define BT_D4_SHFT      4
00390 #define BT_D8_MASK      0xff
00391 #define BT_D8_SHFT      8
00392 #define BT_D16_MASK     0xffffUL
00393 #define BT_D16_SHFT     16
00394 #define BT_D32_MASK     0xffffffffUL
00395 #define BT_D32_SHFT     32
00396 
00397 /*
00398 **  If TRUE has not been defined, define both TRUE and FALSE here
00399 */
00400 #if     !defined(TRUE)
00401 #if     defined(LINT)
00402 #define TRUE    ((bool_t) 1)
00403 #define FALSE   ((bool_t) 0)
00404 #else   /* defined(LINT) */
00405 #define TRUE    (0==0)
00406 #define FALSE   (0!=0)
00407 #endif  /* defined(LINT) */
00408 #endif  /* !defined(TRUE) */
00409 
00410 /*
00411 **  Access flags type and access defines for bt_open() and bt_mmap()
00412 **  This used to be in btapi.h, SGM moved it here because bt_accessflag_t
00413 **  is also used the mmap call which is often just passed to the driver
00414 **  so the driver wants the BT_RD... definitions so they need to be in
00415 **  btdef.h file.
00416 */
00417 
00418 #if     defined(__vxworks)
00419 
00420 typedef int bt_accessflag_t;    /* Want to match type used for open() */
00421 
00422 #else   /* defined(__vxworks) */
00423 
00424 typedef unsigned long bt_accessflag_t;
00425 
00426 #endif  /* defined(__vxworks) */
00427 
00428 #define BT_RD   (1<<0)
00429 #define BT_WR   (1<<1)
00430 #define BT_RDWR (BT_RD | BT_WR)
00431 
00432 #endif  /* _BTDEF_H */
